translation: One Oankar, the primal enegy, realised through The grace of divine preceptor.
One Oankar, the primal enegy, realised through The grace of divine preceptor.
I bow before the primeval Lord who has been told as the primordial cause of all.

gurmukhi: ਸੋ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਸਚਾ ਵੇਸੁ ਸਬਦਿ ਸਿਞਞਞਞਾਣਿਅਾ
transliteration: So Satiguru Sachaa Vaysu Sabadi Siaaniaa.
translation: Truth incarnate that true Guru is realised through the Word.
Only they have realised Him whose surati (consciousness) has merged into the truth after accepting the commands of the Word.
Holy congregation is the genuine basis and authentic abode of truth.
Wherein the individual inspired by loving devotion enjoys the innate delight.
Lord, kind to the devotees and the glory of the poor, also assimilates Himself in the holy congregation.

gurmukhi: ਬ੍ਹਮਾ ਬਿਸਨੁ ਮਹੇਸੁ ਅੰਤੁ ਨ ਜਾਣਿਅਾ
transliteration: Brahamaa Bisanu Mahaysu Antu N Jaaniaa.
translation: Even Brahma, Visnu, Mahesa could not know His mysteries.

gurmukhi: ਸਿਮਰਿ ਸਹਸਿ ਫਣ ਸੇਸੁ ਤਿਲੁ ਨ ਪਛਾਣਿਅਾ
transliteration: Simari Sahasi Dhan Saysu Tilu N Pachhaaniaa.
translation: Sesanag remembering Him with its thousand hoods could not understand Him.
The truth is pleasing to those gurmukhs who have become dervish at the door of holy congregation.
Guru and disciple

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ਚੇਲੇ ਰਹਰਾਸਿ ਅਲਖੁ ਅਭੇੳੁ ਹੈ
transliteration: Guru Chaylay Raharaasi Alakhu Abhayu Hai.
translation: The ways of the Guru and the disciple are mysterious and imperceptible.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰੁ ਚੇਲੇ ਸਾਬਾਸਿ ਨਾਨਕ ਦੇੳੁ ਹੈ
transliteration: Guru Chaylay Saabaasi Naanak Dayu Hai.
translation: Guru (Nanak) and disciple (Angad) both are blest (because both have merged into each other).

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮਤਿ ਸਹਜਿ ਨਿਵਾਸੁ ਸਿਫਤਿ ਸਮੇੳੁ ਹੈ
transliteration: Guramati Sahaji Nivaasu Sidhati Samayu Hai.
translation: Their abode is the wisdom of Guru and they both are rapt in the praises of the Lord.

gurmukhi: ਸਬਦਿ ਸੁਰਤਿ ਪਰਗਾਸ ਅਛਲ ਅਛੇੳੁ ਹੈ
transliteration: Sabadi Surati Paragaas Achhal Achhayu Hai.
translation: Enlightened with the Word their consciousness has become infinite and immutable.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਅਾਸ ਨਿਰਾਸ ਮਤਿ ਅਰਖੇੳੁ ਹੈ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Aas Niraas Mati Arakhayu Hai.
translation: Transcending all hopes they have assimilated subtle wisdom in their person.

gurmukhi: ਕਾਮ ਕਰੋਧ ਵਿਣਾਸੁ ਸਿਫਤਿ ਸਮੇੳੁ ਹੈ
transliteration: Kaam Karodh Vinaasu Sidhati Samayu Hai.
translation: Conquering the lust and anger they have absorbed themselves in the praises (of God).

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿ ਸੰਤੋਖ ੳੁਲਾਸ ਸਕਤਿ ਨ ਸੇੳੁ ਹੈ
transliteration: Sati Santokh Ulaas Sakati N Sayu Hai.
translation: Beyond the abodes of Siva and Sakti they have reached the abode of truth, contentment and  bliss.

gurmukhi: ਘਰ ਹੀ ਵਿਚਿ ੳੁਦਾਸੁ ਸਚੁ ਸੁਚੇੳੁ ਹੈ
transliteration: Ghar Hee Vichi Udaasu Sachu Souchayu Hai.
translation: Being indifferent to household (pleasures) they are truth-oriented.

gurmukhi: ਵੀਹ ੲਿਕੀਹ ਅਭਿਅਾਸ ਗੁਰ ਸਿਖ ਦੇੳੁ ਹੈ ॥੨॥
transliteration: Veeh Ikeeh Abhiaasu Gur Sikh Dayu Hai ?2?
translation: The Guru and disciple have now attain the ratio of twenty and twenty One, i.e.the disciple has gone ahead of the Guru.
Guru and disciple
The disciple who obeys the commands of the Guru is called gurmukh.
The actions of  the gurmukh are awe-inspiring and their glory is indescribable.
Considering creation as the form of the Creator he feels to be a sacrifice unto it.
In the world he feels himself as a guest and the world a guest house.
Truth is his real Guru whom he speaks and listens to.
Like a  bard, at the doors of the holy congregation, he recites the hymns of the Guru (gurbani).
For him the holy congregation is the basis of his acquaintance with the omniscient Lord.
His consciousness remains absorbed in the graceful true Word.
True court of justice for him is the holy congregation and through Word the true identity of it he establishes in his heart.
Guru and disciple

gurmukhi: ਸਬਦੁ ਗੁਰੂ ਗੁਰੁ ਵਾਹੁ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਪਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Sabadu Guroo Guru Vaahu Guramoukhi Paaiaa.
translation: From the Guru the disciple obtains the wondrous Word
And as a disciple, merging his consciousness in it, comes face to face with imperceptible Lord.
Meeting the Guru, the disciple attains turia, the fourth and final stage  of spiritual quietude.
He holds unfathomable and serene Lord dearly in his heart.
Becoming carefree that true disciple merges himself in the truth.
And by becoming the king of kings he makes others subservient to him.
Only he loves the divine will of the Lord.
And only he has tasted the nectar in the form of praises of the Lord.
Taking consciousness into the depth of Word he has shaped the unchiselled mind.
The gurmukh-wayfarer

gurmukhi: ਮੁਲਿ ਨ ਮਿਲੈ ਅਮੋਲੁ ਨ ਕੀਮਤਿ ਪਾੲੀਅੈ
transliteration: Muli N Milai Amolu N Keemati Paaeeai.
translation: The way of life of gurmukhs is invaluable;

gurmukhi: ਪਾੲਿ ਤਰਾਜੂ ਤੋਲ ਨ ਅਤੁਲੁ ਤੁਲਾੲੀਅੈ
transliteration: Paai Taraajoo Tolu N Atulu Tulaaeeai.
translation: It cannot be purchased; on weighing scale it cannot be weighed.

gurmukhi: ਨਿਜ ਘਰਿ ਤਖਤੁ ਅਡੋਲੁ ਨ ਡੋਲੁ ਡੋਲਾੲੀਅੈ
transliteration: Nij Ghari Takhatu Adolu N Doli Dolaaeeai.
translation: Stabilizing in one’s own self and not getting frivolous in his way of life.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਪੰਥ ਨਿਰੋਲੁ ਨ ਰਲੇ ਰਲਾੲੀਅੈ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Pand Nirolu N Ralay Ralaaeeai.
translation: This way is distinct and does not become defiled even when joined with some one else.

gurmukhi: ਕਥਾ ਅਕਥ ਅਬੋਲ ਨ ਬੋਲ ਬੁਲਾੲੀਅੈ
transliteration: Kadaa Akad Abolu N Bol Bulaaeeai.
translation: Its story is indescribable.

gurmukhi: ਸਦਾ ਅਭੁਲੁ ਅਭੋਲ ਨ ਭੋਲਿ ਭੁਲਾੲੀਅੈ
transliteration: Sadaa Abhulu Abholu N Bholi Bhulaaeeai.
translation: This way transcends all ommissions and all anxieties.
Absorbed in equipoise this gurmukh-way of life gives balance to life.
The gurmukh quaffs from  the tank of nectar.

gurmukhi: ਲਖ ਟੋਲੀ ੲਿਕੁ ਟੋਲੁ ਨ ਅਾਪੁ ਗਣਾੲੀਅੈ ॥੫॥
transliteration: Lakh Tolee Ik Tolu N Aapu Ganaaeeai ?5?
translation: The end result of lacs of experiences is the gurmukh  never exhibits his ego.

gurmukhi: ੬ ਗੁਰ ਸਿੱਖੀ ਦਾ ਸੌਦਾ ਤੇ ਖੇਤੀ
translation: The merchandise of a gursikh
From the shop of holy congregation, through the Word, the merchandise of God’s name is procured.

gurmukhi: ਪੂਰਾ ਪੂਰੇ ਵਟਿ ਕਿ ਅਾਖਿ ਸਲਾਹੀਅੈ
transliteration: Pooraa Pooray Vati Ki Aakhi Salaaheeai.
translation: How to praise Him? The measuring criteria of  the perfect Lord are perfect.

gurmukhi: ਕਦੇ ਨ ਹੋਵੈ ਘਟਿ ਸਚੀ ਪਤਿਸਾਹੀਅੈ
transliteration: Kaday N Hovai Ghati Sachee Patisaaheeai.
translation: The warehouse of the True King is never deficient.
Cultivating the True Guru, those who earn through Him get merged into His inexhaustible Being.
The company of the saints is manifestly great; one should always be in and with it.

gurmukhi: ਚਾਵਲ ੲਿਕਤੇ ਸਟਿ ਨ ਦੂਜੀ ਵਾਹੀਅੈ
transliteration: Chaaval Ikatay Sati N Doojee Vaaheeai.
translation: Husk in the form of maya should be separated from the rice of life

gurmukhi: ਜਮ ਦੀ ਫਾਹੀ ਕਟਿ ਦਾਦਿ ੲਿਲਾਹੀਅੈ
transliteration: Jam Dee Dhaahee Kati Daadi Ilaaheeai.
translation: With strokes of discipline during this very life.

transliteration: Panjay Doot Sanghati Su Ddhayree Ddhaaheeai.
translation: All the five evil propensities, should be decimated.

gurmukhi: ਪਾਣੀ ਜਿੳੁ ਹਰਿਹਟਿ ਸੁ ਖੇਤ ੳੁਮਾਹੀਅੈ ॥੬॥
transliteration: Paanee Jiu Harihati Su Khayti Oumaaheeai ?6?
translation: As the  water of well keeps the fields green, the field of the consciousness should be kept verdant (with the help of shabad).
The true guru

gurmukhi: ਪੂਰਾ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਅਾਪਿ ਨ ਅਲਖੁ ਲਖਾਵੲੀ
transliteration: Pooraa Satiguru Aapi N Alakhu Lakhaavaee.
translation: Lord Himself is the true Guru who is imperceptible.

gurmukhi: ਦੇਖੈ ਥਾਪਿ ੳੁਥਾਪਿ ਜਿੳੁ ਤਿਸੁ ਭਾਵੲੀ
transliteration: Daykhai Daapi Udaapi Jiu Tisu Bhaavaee.
translation: Of His own will He Establishes or uproots.

gurmukhi: ਲੇਪੁ ਨ ਪੁੰਨਿ ਨ ਪਾਪਿ ੳੁਪਾੲਿ ਸਮਾਵੲੀ
transliteration: Laypu N Pounni N Paapi Oupaai Samaavaee.
translation: The sin and virtue of creation and destruction do not touch Him at all.

gurmukhi: ਲਾਗੂ ਵਰ ਨ ਸਰਾਪ ਨ ਅਾਪ ਜਣਾਵੲੀ
transliteration: Laagoo Varu N Saraap N Aap Janaavaee.
translation: He never makes anybody notice Him and boons and curses do not stick to Him.
The true Guru recites the Word and unfolds the grandeur of that indescribable Lord.

gurmukhi: ਅਕਥ ਕਥਾ ਜਪੁ ਜਾਪਿ ਨ ਜਗਤੁ ਕਮਾਵੲੀ
transliteration: Akad Kadaa Japu Jaapi N Jagatu Kamaavaee.
translation: Eulogosong the ineffable (Lord) he does not indulge in hypocrisy and guile.
The effulgence of the perfect Guru finishes off the ego of the seekers of knowledge.
The Guru effacing the three suferings (god-sent, physical and spiritual) lessens the anxieties of the people.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਬਾਣੀ ਮਨ ਧ੍ਰਾਪਿ ਨਿਜ ਘਰਿ ਅਾਵੲੀ ॥੭॥
transliteration: Gurabaanee Man Dhraapi Nij Ghari Aavaee ?7?
translation: Getting satiated by the teachings of such a Guru, the individual stays in his innate nature.

gurmukhi: ੯ ਗੁਰਸਿੱਖਾਂ ਲੲੀ ਸਾਧਨ, ਦਸ਼ਾ ਤੇ ਵਰਤਨ
translation: Means for the Sikhs,their state and conduct  ,
The perfect Guru is truth incarnate who is realised by becoming gurmukh.
The desire of the true Guru is that the Word should be sustained;
Burning the ego one will get honour in the court of Lord.

gurmukhi: ਘਰ ਹੀ ਜੋਗ ਜੁਗਤਿ ਬੈਸਣਿ ਧਰਮਸਾਲੀਅੈ
transliteration: Ghar Hee Jog Jougati Baisani Dharamasaaleeai.
translation: One should learn the technique of merging in the Lord by considering one’s home as the place for cultivating dharma.

gurmukhi: ਪਾਵਨ ਮੋਖ ਮੁਕਤਿ ਗੁਰ ਸਿਖਿ ਪਾਲੀਅੈ
transliteration: Paavan Mokh Moukati Gur Sikhi Paaleeai.
translation: Liberation for them is certain who abide by the teaching of the Guru.
They having loving devotion in their heart remain jubliant.
Such people are emperors full of delight.
Becoming egoless  they serve the sangat, congregation, by bringing water, grinding corn etc. for it.
In humility and joy they lead altogether distinct life.
Characteristics of gurmukhs
The Guru preaches to the Sikh to be pure in conduct.
He (gurmukh) joining the congregation remains absorbed in the Word.
In the company of flowers the sesame oil also becomes scented.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ਸਿਖ ਨਕ ਨਕੇਲ ਮਿਟੈ ਅੰਦੇਸਿਅਾ
transliteration: Gur Sikh Nak Nakayl Mitai Andaysiaa.
translation: Nose – string of God’s Will remains in the nose of the Sikh of the Guru i.e. he always keeps himself ready to be  subservient to the Lord.
Taking bath in the ambrosial hours he remains enrapt in the region of the Lord.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ਜਪ ਰਿਦੈ ਸੁਹੇਲ ਗੁਰ ਪਰਵੇਸਿਅਾ
transliteration: Gur Japu Ridai Suhaylu Gur Paravaysiaa.
translation: Remembering Guru in his heart he becomes one with Him.

gurmukhi: ਭਾੳੁ ਭਗਤਿ ਭੳੁ ਭੇਲ ਸਾਧ ਸਰੇਸਿਅਾ
transliteration: Bhaau Bhagati Bhau Bhaylu Saadh Saraysiaa.
translation: He having the fear of the Lord and a loving devotion, is known as the sadhu of high stature.

gurmukhi: ਨਿਤ ਨਿਤ ਨਵਲ ਨਵੇਲ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਭੇਸਿਅਾ
transliteration: Nit Nit Naval Navayl Guramoukhi Bhaysiaa.
translation: The fast colour of the Lord goes on compounding on a gurmukh.
The gurmukh only remains with the supreme Lord who is the giver of supreme delight and fearlessness.
The dust of the feet

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ਮੂਰਤਿ ਕਰਿ ਧਿਅਾਨ ਸਦਾ ਹਜੂਰ ਹੈ
transliteration: Gur Moorati Kari Dhiaan Sadaa Hajoor Hai.
translation: Concentrate upon the Guru-word considering it as the figure of the Guru who is always with you.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸਬਦ ਗਿਅਾਨੁ ਨੇੜਿ ਨ ਦੂਰ ਹੈ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Sabadu Giaanu Nayrhi N Door Hai.
translation: Due to the knowledge of the Word, the gurmukh finds the Lord always near and not far off.

gurmukhi: ਪੂਰਬ ਲਿਖਤ ਨੀਸਾਨ ਕਰਮ ਅੰਕੂਰ ਹੈ
transliteration: Purabi Likhatu Neesaanu Karam Ankoor Hai.
translation: But the seed of karmas aprouts according to the previous karmas.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ਸੇਵਾ ਪਰਧਾਨ ਸੇਵਕ ਸੂਰ ਹੈ
transliteration: Gur Sayvaa Paradhaanu Sayvak Soor Hai.
translation: The valiant servant becomes leader in doing service to the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਪੂਰਨ ਪਰਮ ਨਿਧਾਨ ਸਦ ਭਰਪੂਰ ਹੈ
transliteration: Pooran Param Nidhaan Sad Bharapoor Hai.
translation: God, the supreme store house is always full and omnipresent.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧ ਸੰਗਤਿ ਅਸਥਾਨ ਜਗਮਗ ਨੂਰ ਹੈ
transliteration: Saadhasangati Asadaanu Jag Mag Noor Hai.
translation: His glory shines forth in the holy congregation of the saints.

gurmukhi: ਲਖ ਲਖ ਸਸੀਅਰ ਭਾਨੁ ਕਿਰਨ ਠਰੂਰ ਹੈ
transliteration: Lakh Lakh Saseear Bhaanu Kirani Tdaroor Hai.
translation: The brightness of myriads of moons and suns is subdued before the light of the holy congregation.

gurmukhi: ਲਖ ਲਖ ਬੇਦ ਪੁਰਾਣਿ ਕੀਰਤਨ ਚੂਰ ਹੈ
transliteration: Lakh Lakh Bayd Puraani Keeratan Choor Hai.
translation: Millions of Vedas and Puranas are insignificant before the praises of the Lord.

gurmukhi: ਭਗਤਿ ਵਛਲ ਪਰਵਾਣੁ ਚਰਣਾ ਧੂਰ ਹੈ ॥੧੦॥
transliteration: Bhagati Vachhal Paravaanu Charanaa Dhoor Hai ?10?
translation: The dust of the feet of the beloved of the Lord is dear to the gurmukh.
Oneness of the Guru and the Sikh

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ਸਿਖੁ ਸਿਖੁ ਗੁਰ ਸੋੲਿ ਅਲਖੁ ਲਖਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Gur Sikhu Sikhu Gur Soi Alakhu Lakhaaiaa.
translation: Being one with each other the Guru and the Sikh have made the Lord  perceptible (in the form of Guru).

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ਦੀਖਿਅਾ ਲੈ ਸਿਖ ਸਿਖੁ ਸਦਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Gur Deekhiaa Lai Sikhi Sikhu Sadaaiaa.
translation: Getting initiated by the Guru the disciple has become a Sikh.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ਸਿਖ ੲਿੱਕੋ ਹੋੲਿ ਜੋ ਗੁਰ ਭਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Gur Sikh Iko Hoi Jo Gur Bhaaiaa.
translation: It was the Lord’s desire that the Guru and the disciple would become one.
It seems as if the diamond cutting the diamond has brought the other one in one string;
Or the wave of water has merged in water, or the light of one lamp has come to reside in another lamp.
The wondrous deed (of the Lord) seems to have been transformed into a parable.
It is as if the sacred ghee has been produced after churning the curd.
The One Light has scattered in all the three worlds.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਕ ਚਾਨਣੁ ਤ੍ਹਿੁ ਲੋੲਿ ਪ੍ਰਗਟੀ ਅਾੲਿਅਾ ॥੧੧॥
translation: It is as if the sacred ghee has been produced after churning the curd. The
Oneness of the Guru and the Sikh

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਨਾਨਕ ਦੇੳੁ ਗੁਰਾ ਗੁਰੁ ਹੋੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Satigur Naanak Dayu Guraa Guru Hoiaa.
translation: The True Guru Nanak Dev was the Guru of Gurus.
He installed Guru Angad Dev on the invisible abd mysterious throne of equipoise.
Merging Amar Das into the external Lord he made him see the invisible.
Guru Ram  Das was made to quaff the delight of supreme nectar.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ਅਰਜਨ ਕਰਿ ਸੇੳੁ ਢੋਅੈ ਢੋੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Gur Arajan Kari Sayu Ddhoai Ddhoiaa.
translation: Guru Arjan Dev got the largess of service (from Guru Ram Das).

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰੁ ਹਰਿ ਗੋਬਿੰਦੁ ਅਮੇੳੁ ਅਮਿੳੁ ਵਿਲੋੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Gur Hari Gobind Amayu Amiu Viloiaa.
translation: Guru Hargobind also churned the sea (of Word)
And due to the grace of all these truthful personalities, the truth of the Lord has come to reside in the hearts of common people, who have fully devoted their selves to the Word.
Even empty hearts of the people have been filled by sabad, the Word

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖ ਅਭਰ ਭਰੇੳੁ ਭਰਮ ਭੳੁ ਖੋੲਿਅਾ ॥੧੨॥
transliteration: Guramoukh Abhar Bharayu Bharam Bhau Khoiaa ?12?
translation: And the Gurmukhs have exterminated their fears and delusions.
Gurmukh

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਭੳੁ ਭਾੳੁ ਸਹਜੁ ਬੈਰਾਗ ਹੈ
transliteration: Saadhasangati Bhau Bhaau Sahaju Bairaagu Hai.
translation: Fear (of God) and love (for mankind) being diffused in the holy congregation the sense of non-attachment always prevails.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸਹਜਿ ਸੁਭਾੳੁ ਸੁਰਤਿ ਸੁ ਜਾਗੁ ਹੈ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Sahaji Soubhaau Surati Su Jaagu Hai.
translation: By nature, the Gurmukhs  remian alert i.e. their consciousness remains attuned to Sabad, the Word.

gurmukhi: ਮਧੁਰ ਬਚਨ ਅਾਲਾੳੁ ਹੳੁਮੈ ਤਿਅਾਗ ਹੈ
transliteration: Madhur Bachan Aalaau Haoumai Tiaagu Hai.
translation: They speak sweet words and they have already expelled ego from their  selves.

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਮਤਿ ਪਰਥਾੳੁ ਸਦਾ ਅਨੁਰਾਗੁ ਹੈ
transliteration: Satigur Mati Paradaau Sadaa Anuraagu Hai.
translation: Conducting themselves according to the wisdom of the Guru they always remain imbued in love (of the Lord).

gurmukhi: ਪਿਰਮ ਪਿਅਾਲੇ ਸਾੳੁ ਮਸਤਕਿ ਭਾਗ ਹੈ
transliteration: Piram Piaalay Saau Masataki Bhaagu Hai.
translation: They feeling fortunate quaff the cup of love (of the Lord).

gurmukhi: ਬ੍ਹਮ ਜੋਤਿ ਬ੍ਹਮਾੳੁ ਗਿਅਾਨੁ ਚਰਾਗੁ ਹੈ
transliteration: Braham Joti Brahamaau Giaanu Charaagu Hai.
translation: Realising the light of the Supreme in their  mind they become competent to light the lamp of divine knowledge.

gurmukhi: ਅੰਤਰਿ ਗੁਰਮਤਿ ਚਾੳੁ ਅਲਿਪਤੁ ਅਦਾਗੁ ਹੈ
transliteration: Antari Guramati Chaau Alipatu Adaagu Hai.
translation: Due  to the wisdom obtained from Guru they have unlimited enthusiasm and  they remain untouched by maya and the dirt of the evil propensities.

gurmukhi: ਵੀਹ ੲਿਕੀਹ ਚੜ੍ਹਾੳੁ ਸਦਾ ਸੁਹਾਗੁ ਹੈ ॥੧੩॥
transliteration: Veeh Ikeeh Charhhaau Sadaa Suhaagu Hai ?13?
translation: In the context of worldliness, they always conduct themselves in a superior position i.e. if the world is twenty, they are twenty one.
Gurmukh
The words of gurmukh should always be cherished in one’s heart.
By the  benevolent glance of the gurmukh one becomes blest and happy.
Rare are those who attain the sense of discipline and service.
Gurmukhs being full of love are kind to the poor.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਨਿਬਹੈ ਨਾਲਿ ਗੁਰ ਸਿਖ ਪਾਲੀਅੈ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Nibahai Naali Gur Sikh Paaleeai.
translation: Gurmukh is ever steadfast and always adheres to the teachings of the Guru.
One should seek jewels and rubies from the gurmukhs.
Gurmukhs are devoid of deception; they, without becoming victim of Time, go on enjoying the delight of devotion.
Gurmukhs have discriminatory wisdom of swans (who can separate milk from water), and they with their mind and body love their Lord.
Mystery of the Mulmantr
By writing 1 (One) in the beginning, it has been shown that Ekankar, God, who subsumes all forms in Him is only one (and not two or three).
Ura,  the first Gurmukhi letter, in the form of Oankar shows the world controlling power of that one Lord.
That Lord has been understood as the True-Name, Creator and the Fearless One.
He is devoid of rancour, beyond time and free from the cycle of transmigration.
Hail the Lord! His mark is truth and He shines in bright effulgent flame.
Five letters (1 Oankar) are altruists; they have in them the power of the person of the Lord.
The individual, understanding their import becomes blest with graceful glance of God who is the essence of delights.

gurmukhi: ਨੳੁ ਅੰਗਿ ਸੁੰਨ ਸੁਮਾਰ ਸੰਗਿ ਨਿਰਾਲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Nau Angi Sounn Soumaaru Sangi Niraaliaa.
translation: As the numerals from one to nine adding zero with them reach to the infinite count
The persons who quaff the cup of love from their beloved become master of infinite powers.
Unity among the four varnas
The people of all the four varnas sit together in the company of gurmukhs.
All the disciples become gurmukh as betel leaf, lime and chatehu when mixed become of one red colour.
All the five sounds (produced by different instruments) keep the gurmukhs full of joy.
In the waves of the Word of the true Guru, gurmukhs ever remain in delight.

gurmukhi: ਸਬਦ ਸੁਰਤਿ ਪਰਸੰਗ ਗਿਅਾਨ ਸੰਗ ਮੇਲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Sabad Surati Parasang Giaan Sang Mayliaa.
translation: Joining their consciousness to the Guru’s teachings, they become knowledgeable.
They keep themselves absorbed day and night in the great resonance of Gurbani, the holy hymns.
Drowned into the infinite Word and its steadfast colour only the One (God) is realised.
Out of the twelve ways (of yogis) the way of the gurmukhs is the correct way.
Collyrium of the Gursikhs
In the primordial times the Lord ordained.
The Word of the Guru met with the Sabda-brahm Word-God and the ego of creatures got erased.
This  very awe-inspiring word is the collyrium of gurmukhs.
Adopting Gurmat, the wisdom of the Guru, with the grace of the Guru, the delusions are  eschewed.
That primordial being is beyond time and destruction.
He  bestows grace upon His servants like Siva and Sanaks et al.

gurmukhi: ਜਪੀਅੈ ਜੁਗਹੁ ਜੁਗਾਦਿ ਗੁਰ ਸਿਖ ਮੰਜਨੋ
transliteration: Japeeai Jougahu Jougaadi Gur Sikh Manjano.
translation: In all the ages only He is remembered and He alone is the object of concentration of the Sikhs.
Through the taste of the cup of love that Supreme Love is known.
Since the primordial time He has been delighting all.
The true disciple

gurmukhi: ਮੁਰਦਾ ਹੋੲਿ ਮੁਰੀਦ ਨ ਗਲੀ ਹੋਵਣਾ
transliteration: Muradaa Hoi Mureedu N Galee Hovanaa.
translation: Only by becoming dead in life, i.e. totally detached, and not through mere verbal jargon one can become a true disciple.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਬਰੁ ਸਿਦਕਿ ਸਹੀਦੁ ਭਰਮ ਭੳੁ ਖੋਵਣਾ
transliteration: Saabaru Sidaki Saheedu Bharam Bhau Khovanaa.
translation: One could be such a person only after getting sacrificed for truth and contentment and by eschewing delusions and fears.
The true disciple is a boughten slave who is ever busy in the service of the Master.

gurmukhi: ਨਾ ਤਿਸੁ ਭੁਖ ਨ ਨੀਦ ਨ ਖਾਣਾ ਸੋਵਣਾ
transliteration: Naa Tisu Bhoukh N Need N Khaanaa Sovanaa.
translation: He forgets hunger, sleep, food and rest.
He  grinds fresh flour (for free kitchen) and serves by fetching water.

gurmukhi: ਪਖੇ ਦੀ ਤਾਗੀਦ ਪਗ ਮਲਿ ਧੋਵਣਾ
transliteration: Pakhay Dee Taageed Pag Mali Dhovanaa.
translation: He fans (the congregation) and washes nicely the feet of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਸੇਵਕ ਹੋੲਿ ਸੰਜੀਦੁ ਨ ਹਸਣ ਰੋਵਣਾ
transliteration: Sayvak Hoi Sanjeedu N Hasanu Rovanaa.
translation: The servant  always remains disciplined and has nothing to do with wailing and laughing.

gurmukhi: ਦਰ ਦਰਵੇਸ ਰਸੀਦੁ ਪਿਰਮ ਰਸ ਭੋਵਣਾ
transliteration: Dar Daravays Raseedu Piram Rasu Bhovanaa.
translation: This way he becomes dervish at the door of the Lord and gets drenched in the delights of the rains of love.
He will be seen as the first moon of Id day (which the Muslims eagerly wait for in order to break their long fasts), and only he will come out as a perfect man.
What is demanded of a disciple  ?

transliteration: Pairee Pai Paa Khaaku Mureedai Theevanaa.
translation: By becoming the dust of the feet the disciple is required to be near the feet of the the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ਮੂਰਤਿ ਮੁਸਤਾਕੁ ਮਰਿ ਮਰਿ ਜੀਵਣਾ
transliteration: Gur Moorati Mousataaku Mari Mari Jeevanaa.
translation: Becoming an avid suiter of the form (word) of the Guru and being dead to greed, infatuation and other relational propensities, he should remain alive in the world.
Repudiating all worldly connections he must remain dyed in the colour of the Lord.

gurmukhi: ਹੋਰ ਨ ਝਖਣੁ ਝਾਕ ਸਰਣਿ ਮਨੁ ਸੀਵਣਾ
transliteration: Hor N Jhakhanu Jhaak Sarani Manu Seevanaa.
translation: Seeking no shelter elsewhere he should keep his mind absorbed in the shelterof God, the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਪਿਰਮ ਪਿਅਾਲਾ ਪਾਕ ਅਮਿਅ ਰਸੁ ਪੀਵਣਾ
transliteration: Piram Piaalaa Paak Amia Rasu Peevanaa.
translation: Sacred is the cup of the love of the beloved; he should quaff that only.
Making humility his abode he should get poised in it.
Divorcing the (tastes of ) ten organs i.e.not being caught in their dragnet, he should attain equipose.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਵਧਾਨ ਗੁਰ ਵਾਕ ਨ ਮਨ ਭਰਮੀਵਣਾ
transliteration: Saavadhaan Gur Vaak N Man Bharameevanaa.
translation: He must be fully conscious about the word of Guru and should not allow the mind to be entrapped in delusions.
Absorption of consciousness in the Word makes  him alert and this way one gets across the Word – ocean.
Who is the acknowledged Sikh   ?
He is true Sikh who surrenders before the Guru and bows his head;

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ਚਰਣੀ ਚਿਤੁ ਲਾੲਿ ਮਥਾ ਲਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Gur Charanee Chitu Laai Madaa Laaiaa.
translation: Who puts his mind and forehead on the feet of Guru;
Who holding dear to his heart the teachings of the Guru expels ego from his self;
Who loves the will of Lord and has attained equipoise by becoming Guru-oriented, gurmukh;

transliteration: Sabadi Surati Liv Laai Houkamu Kamaaiaa.
translation: Who by merging his consciousness in the Word has acted according to the divine Will (hukam).

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਭੈ ਭਾੲਿ ਨਿਜ ਘਰਿ ਪਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Saadhasangati Bhai Bhaai Nij Gharu Paaiaa.
translation: He (the true Sikh) as the result of his love and fear of holy congregation attains his own self (atma).
He remains stuck to the lotus feet of the Guru like the black bee.
Getting enveloped in this delight  he goes on quaffing the nectar.
Blessed is the mother of such a person. Only his coming to this world is fruitful.

gurmukhi: ਜਗਮਗ ਜੋਤਿ ਸਰੂਪ ਪਰਮ ਜੋਤਿ ਮਿਲ ਜੋਤਿ ਮਹਿ
transliteration: Jagamag Joti Saroopa , Param Joti Mil Joti Mahi ?
translation: The light eternal of Guru Nanak Dev melded into the light of Guru Angad Dev who acquired effulgence like the former.

gurmukhi: ਅਦਭੁਤ ਅਤਹਿ ਅਨੂਪ ਪਰਮ ਤਤੁ ਤਤਹਿ ਮਿਲਿਓ ॥੧॥੩॥
transliteration: Adabhout Atahi Anoopa , Param Tatu Tatahi Miliao ?1?3?
translation: With the light of Guru Nanak merging with that of Guru Angad Dev Ji, the latter became wondrous in form and beyond words of praise.

gurmukhi: ਪਰਮ ਜੋਤਿ ਮਿਲਿ ਜੋਤਿ ਮਹਿ ਜਗਮਗ ਜੋਤਿ ਸਰੂਪ
transliteration: Param Joti Mili Joti Mahi , Jagamag Joti Saroop ?
translation: Light supreme (Guru Nanak Dev Ji) merged in Guru Angad Dev's light who himself became light divine.

gurmukhi: ਪਰਮ ਤਤ ਤਤਹਿ ਮਿਲਿਓ ਅਦਭੁਤ ਅਤ ਹੀ ਅਨੂਪ ॥੨॥੩॥
transliteration: Param Tat Tatahi Miliao , Adabhout At Hee Anoop ?2?3?
translation: Truth of Guru Nanak merged with the essence of Guru Angad transforming him into astonishing form.

gurmukhi: ਅਦਭੁਤ ਅਤਿ ਹੀ ਅਨੂਪ ਰੂਪ ਪਾਰਸ ਕੈ ਪਾਰਸ
transliteration: Adabhout Ati Hee Anoopa , Roop Paaras Kai Paaras ?
translation: Guru Angad coming in contact with Guru Nanak the philosopher-stone, became a philosopher-stone himself. His form too became wondrous.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ਅੰਗਦ ਮਿਲਿ ਅੰਗ ਸੰਗ ਮਿਲਿ ਸੰਗ ੳੁਧਾਰਸ
transliteration: Gur Angad Mili Anga , Sang Mili Sang Udhaaras ?
translation: Becoming inseparable from Guru Nanak, Lehna Ji became Guru Angad and then whosoever came in touch with him (Guru Angad) was liberated.

gurmukhi: ਅਕਲ ਕਲਾ ਭਰਪੂਰਿ ਸੂਤ੍ਰ ਗਤਿ ਓਤਿ ਪੋਤਿ ਮਹਿ
transliteration: Akal Kalaa Bharapoori , Sootr Gati Aoti Poti Mahi ?
translation: Guru Angad Ji integrated himself like warp and weft with Guru Nanak, the possessor of Divine power of the Lord.

gurmukhi: ਜਗਮਗ ਜੋਤਿ ਸਰੂਪ ਜੋਤਿ ਮਿਲਿ ਜੋਤਿ ਜੋਤਿ ਮਹਿ ॥੩॥੩॥
transliteration: Jagamag Joti Saroopa , Joti Mili Joti Joti Mahi ?3?3?
translation: Light merged with light so much that whosoever came in contact with light embodiment (Guru Angad) , became resplendent too. (3)
